description: After reading the book "Programming in Haskell" by Graham Huttom, I wanted to go back to the game of life example and implement own version of it with a graphical user interface. I did quick search of Haskell GUI libraries and found out that there exists Haskell bindings for Qt Quick. I was familiar with Qt but I didn't have any experience with QML so I decided that now is the perfect time to try it out.
name: Game of life (HsQML)

description: Simple dice game for one or two players. One of the first games I implemented at the age of thirteen.
name: Täysi Tusina

description: Reaction game made for Windows.
name: Nopeustesti

description: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire style game with high-score list.
name: Tiedä tai Arvaa

description: Formula 1 management game that has text based UI. One of my first C++ programs.
name: F1 Manageri

description: This was a very diverse game project. I was studying physics & math, recording sounds, drawing graphics and of course programming. The goal of the projet was to focus on realistic physics instead of cool graphics. Features: automatic track generation, sounds, collision detection, simple graphics but advanced physics (torque curves, slip angles, aerodynamics, Runge-Kutta integration RK4)
name: Rally Roads

description: Plugin for playing pacenotes in rFactor racing simulation. The plugin used DirectMusic/DirectSound API to play the audio files. The screenshot is just showing the configuration file in Notepad.
name: rFactor Pacenotes Plugin

description: 3D racing game for Android devices. During the development I worked with many interesting topics. In addition to programming, I did 3D modeling with Blender, vector graphics with Inkscape, image editing with GIMP and sound editing with Audacity.
name: Two Wheel Challenge

description: Single-page application for creating and sharing portfolios. The application utilizes MEAN (MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, Node.js) stack. Users can share a link to their portfolio to showcase their talents.
name: My Projects Portfolio

description: Simple grocery list application for Android. Available for download at the Play store.
name: Buy These Groceries

description: A Facebook game where you can create your own racing team and compete with your friends.
name: Racing Manager Online

description: I was the webmaster of OtaKoppi ry during 2009 - 2012. During those years I implemented and maintained the otakoppi.fi website. The website was running in Joomla content management system. I also implemented some membership management features with PHP to the site. For example, I created a registration form for new members and some administration functionalities, such as, sending automatically generated emails about membership fee.
name: otakoppi.fi

description: I implemented a website for the Finnish Student Championship games in finnish baseball for the years 2010 and 2011. The website had information about the event and a registration form made with PHP.
name: otakoppi.fi/opsm

description: Me and my friend implemented the noto.fi website based on already designed visual layouts. I used PHP to create support for multiple languages and to implement a picture gallery.
name: noto.fi

description: A reaction game made for S60 touchscreen devices.
name: React

description: I made this game together with my fellow university student. I implemented the skybox, environment mapping and the glow effects.
name: Rubik's Cube

description: Turn-based racing game for 1 – 2 players. I also implemented AI driver for the game.
name: Formula peli

description: BigT (Basic internalization/globalization Translations) is an easy to use localization library inpired by QT's tr() translation function. Translations are stored in a CSV file so translators can work, for example, with Excel or Google Sheets.
name: BigT

description: Felis is a single page application I have been developing to study ClojureScript and Reagent.
name: Felis - Simple todo app

description: A tile for Windows Start menu for displaying how many hours you have worked today.
name: WorkTimeApp

description: Scala program that runs in AWS cloud. Can be used to enrich RSS feeds so that the feed items will contain the whole article in description field.
name: Feed Enricher

description: A web page that lists my hobby programming projects. Uses React for user interface components, ES6 features for data fetching and Webpack for bundling.
name: Tommi's Portfolio

description: An Unity project that displays my portfolio in virtual reality. I built this to gain experience of virtual reality interaction methods. I also wanted to try out to fetch data asynchronously from web to Unity application.
name: In the Middle of Nowhere

description: Open source wheel collider for Unity. I wasn't completely satisfied with Unity's built-in wheel collider so I decided to implement my own.
name: PrimeTyre

description: Android application that displays when phone was connected to (and disconnected from) Wi-Fi hotspots.
name: Hotspot Logger

description: Store/inventory system for Unity. Designed for easy use and customization. Uses Zenject to keep the implementation loosely coupled. Utilizes UniRx to implement Model - View - Reactive Presenter pattern for the user interface.
name: Simple Store

description: Mobile application for tracking work time.
name: Nine to Five

description: Easy to use app for tracking baby/newborn feeding times.
name: Jason

description: Single page web template with a guestbook
name: Wedding site

description: Wear OS version of the Nine to Five application. Designed for tracking work time.
name: Nine to Five (Wear OS)

description: Wear OS watch face with support for complications
name: Razorbill

description: A sleep log application I made to experiment with React hooks and TypeScript
name: zzz-tracker
